definition: race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)
fig. unmarried person/single person (especially one who is comfortable financially)

sentences.english: Each rank of the peerage was represented.
sentences.chinese: 每个贵族阶级都有代表。

sentences.english: Pround since nobles tend to; he is nervous to see me.
sentences.chinese: 这些贵族只管即便傲岸，他却畏怯见到我。

sentences.english: These patricians don’t need gaudy symbols to advertise their wealth.
sentences.chinese: 这群贵族并不需要花俏的商标来炫耀他们的财富。
假贵族喜欢假冒的奢侈品。

sentences.english: With him went the noble levy and the private magnate armies.
sentences.chinese: 征募的贵族民团和权贵的私军与他同行。

sentences.english: ( a ) They included barons and representatives from counties and towns.
sentences.chinese: 他们包括贵族和县，镇的代表。

sentences.english: Later, aristocrats and literary figures helped expand the ceremony to common people.
sentences.chinese: 后来，贵族和文人学士把中秋祭月的传统推广到民间。

sentences.english: He's been elevated to the peerage.
She was hostess also to Clifford's occasional aristocratic relations.
sentences.chinese: 她也款待着克利福的不常来的贵族亲戚们。

sentences.english: MM: I was born to noble parents, but orphaned at a young age.
sentences.chinese: 我在一个贵族家里出生，但是很小的时候父母双亡。

sentences.english: Armed with lances and encased in plate armour these loyal warriors act as retinues and bodyguards for royalty.
sentences.chinese: 男爵亲卫骑兵是忠诚的贵族卫队，装备板甲和骑枪。

sentences.english: Qingdafu is the largest-scale noble class under the leadership of the king.
sentences.chinese: 卿大夫家族是国君统御之下规模最大的贵族阶层。

sentences.english: Or just lots of other wild singles.
sentences.chinese: 或者只是更多其他狂野的单身贵族？

sentences.english: who had been imprisoned in the Bastille for twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 这个贵族已在巴士底狱被关押了20年。

sentences.english: The Noble officials are scheduled to see President Demetris Christofias today.
sentences.chinese: 贵族官员预计今天看到总统赫里斯托菲亚斯。

sentences.english: The House of Lords is the Upper House of the British Parliament.
sentences.chinese: 贵族院就是英国议会的上院。

definition: royal family/imperial household/member of the royal family
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
